Sentencas: It is well known that cell imbalance can lead to failure of batteries.
Titulo: A study of solid oxide fuel cell stack failure by inducing abnormal behavior in a single cell test

Sentencas: Prior theoretical modeling has shown that similar failure can occur in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stacks due to cell imbalance.
Titulo: A study of solid oxide fuel cell stack failure by inducing abnormal behavior in a single cell test

Sentencas: Central to failure model for SOFC stacks is the abnormal operation of a cell with cell voltage becoming negative.
Titulo: A study of solid oxide fuel cell stack failure by inducing abnormal behavior in a single cell test

Sentencas: For investigation of SOFC stack failure by simulating abnormal behavior in a single cell test, thin yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolyte, anode-supported cells were tested at 800 degrees C with hydrogen as fuel and air as oxidant with and without an applied DC bias.
Titulo: A study of solid oxide fuel cell stack failure by inducing abnormal behavior in a single cell test

Sentencas: When under a DC bias with cell operating under a negative voltage, rapid degradation occurred characterized by increased cell resistance.
Titulo: A study of solid oxide fuel cell stack failure by inducing abnormal behavior in a single cell test

Sentencas: Visual and microscopic examination revealed that delamination occurred along the electrolyte/anode interface.
Titulo: A study of solid oxide fuel cell stack failure by inducing abnormal behavior in a single cell test

Sentencas: The present results show that anode-supported SOFC stacks with YSZ electrolyte are prone to catastrophic failure due to internal pressure buildup, provided cell imbalance occurs.
Titulo: A study of solid oxide fuel cell stack failure by inducing abnormal behavior in a single cell test

Sentencas: The present results also suggest that the greater the number of cells in an SOFC stack, the greater is the propensity to catastrophic failure.
Titulo: A study of solid oxide fuel cell stack failure by inducing abnormal behavior in a single cell test
